headline: Bradyzoite-specific expression with dramatic upregulation during chronic infection
one_paragraph_summary: This gene exhibits remarkable stage-specific expression in Toxoplasma gondii, being dramatically upregulated in bradyzoites compared to all other life cycle stages. Expression increases over 3000-fold during tachyzoite-to-bradyzoite conversion and reaches extremely high levels (>6000 TPM) in tissue cysts during chronic infection. The gene shows minimal expression in tachyzoites, merozoites, oocysts, and enteroepithelial stages, but ranks in the 99th percentile during bradyzoite differentiation across multiple experimental systems. This consistent and dramatic bradyzoite-specific expression pattern suggests the gene likely plays a critical role in chronic infection biology, potentially involved in cyst formation, maintenance, or bradyzoite-specific metabolic processes essential for parasite persistence in the host.

topics.headline: Dramatic bradyzoite-specific upregulation across multiple experimental systems
topics.one_sentence_summary: The gene shows consistent and dramatic upregulation (3-4000 fold increases) during bradyzoite differentiation across multiple time series experiments, reaching 96-99th percentile expression levels and maintaining high expression in mature bradyzoites both in vitro and in vivo.

topics.headline: Strong downregulation in merozoites versus tachyzoites
topics.one_sentence_summary: Expression is dramatically reduced in merozoites compared to tachyzoites, with 8-400 fold decreases observed across independent studies, indicating stage-specific suppression during the merozoite phase of the life cycle.

topics.headline: Extremely high expression during chronic brain infection
topics.one_sentence_summary: The gene shows exceptionally high expression (>4000-6000 TPM, 99th percentile) during chronic infection in mouse brain tissue and maintains stable high levels across extended chronic infection timepoints.

topics.headline: Comprehensive life cycle analysis confirms bradyzoite specificity
topics.one_sentence_summary: Full life cycle transcriptome studies demonstrate that this gene has the most dramatic stage-specific expression pattern possible, with tissue cyst expression being 27-fold higher than tachyzoites and over 3000-fold higher than all other life cycle stages.

topics.headline: Strain-dependent expression variation in tachyzoites
topics.one_sentence_summary: Expression shows remarkable variation across different T. gondii strains, with some strains showing high expression while others have virtually undetectable levels, suggesting strain-specific regulatory mechanisms.

topics.headline: MORC-mediated gene silencing controls expression
topics.one_sentence_summary: The gene is dramatically upregulated (200-600 fold) following MORC knockdown, indicating it is normally silenced by MORC-mediated chromatin regulation in tachyzoites.
